page.title: 14HOME LIFE
page.content: {HOME LIFE ON MARSH FARM} The survey was carried out at Lea Manor High School where 63 1st-4th year pupils were questioned about their home life.Of the sixty three homes where the pupils lived, fifty nine lived in houses, three in bungalows and one in a maisonette. The majority of houses in the survey were terraced and the average amount of rooms in a house were eight. The most frequent household appliance was a colour television, second was a washing machine and third a video. The average number of people per family was four,the largest family comprised of eight people, and the smallest was three.Fifty seven pupils families had transport,each owned a car,two families owned two cars,while one family owned three cars.
